TWODSIX.Actor.Items.Name: Name
TWODSIX.Actor.Skills.SkillRollTooltip: Shows the skill roll dialog. Shift-clicking rolls a skill check applying no modifier and assumes a difficulty of 8
TWODSIX.Actor.Skills.InvertedSkillRollTo: Rolls a skill check applying no modifier and assumes a difficulty of 8. Shift-clicking shows the skill roll dialog
TWODSIX.Handlebars.CantShowCharacteristi: You need to reselect the characteristic for all skills marked with XXX. Sorry...
TWODSIX.Items.Augmentation.Head: Head
TWODSIX.Migration.Completed: Twodsix System Migration to version {version} completed!
TWODSIX.Migration.DoNotClose: Migrating Twodsix to {version}. Do not close your game or shut down your server.
TWODSIX.Migration.MigrationError0.6.25: Migration error: Couldn't parse price for ${name}, it was ${price} but is now 0.
TWODSIX.Modules.compendiumFolders.missin: The included compendiums for the various Cepheus variants often use the 'Compendium Folders' module. If you use those, please install the Compendium Folders module in Foundry VTT. Or turn off this warning in System Settings.
TWODSIX.Modules.compendiumFolders.disabl: Please enable the 'Compendium Folders' module in this world if you intend to use the included compendiums. Or turn off this warning in System Settings.
TWODSIX.Settings.ruleset.hint: This will configure the below settings with the best options for the given ruleset.
TWODSIX.Settings.ruleset.name: Ruleset
TWODSIX.Settings.absoluteBonusValueForEa: Leave empty to use default (+/-1). Not currently used.
What bonus/penalty to give per each time increment change in a task.
TWODSIX.Settings.absoluteCriticalEffectV: Defaults to 99, which means that effect is ignored.
What effect is required for a throw to be considered a critical success/failure (i.e. be colored green/red).
TWODSIX.Settings.automateDamageRollOnHit: checked=Roll damage, modified by effect of skill roll. unchecked=Don't roll damage.
Automatically roll damage on skill rolls that hit (i.e. get effect > 0) with items that do damage?
TWODSIX.Settings.criticalNaturalAffectsE: checked=Regardless of success consider a natural 2 to have an effect of -1 and a 12 to have an effect of 0, unchecked=Use normal rules
Whether a natural 2 or 12 should have special treatment as regards to success/failure.
TWODSIX.Settings.defaultTokenSettings.hi: Automatically set advised prototype token settings to newly created Actors.
TWODSIX.Settings.effectOrTotal.hint: checked=Show effect (i.e. roll+modifiers-target number, usually 8), unchecked=Show total (i.e. roll+modifiers)
TWODSIX.Settings.effectOrTotal.name: Show effect or total roll value for skill and characteristic rolls.
TWODSIX.Settings.initiativeFormula.name: Initiative Formula
TWODSIX.Settings.maxSkillLevel.name: Maximum skill level.
TWODSIX.Settings.modifierForZeroCharacte: Leave empty to use default (-2). Does not automatically recalculate modifiers for existing characters.
Modifier for characteristic value of zero.
TWODSIX.Settings.showMissingCompendiumWa: Whether to show warnings for missing/disabled modules on world start.
Records the schema version for the Twodsix system. (Don't modify this unless you know what you are doing)
TWODSIX.Settings.termForAdvantage.hint: Don't use the same as for termForDisadvantage...
TWODSIX.Settings.termForAdvantage.name: What you want to call rolls with advantage (3d6kh2).
TWODSIX.Settings.termForDisadvantage.hin: Don't use the same as for termForAdvantage...
TWODSIX.Settings.termForDisadvantage.nam: What you want to call rolls with disadvantage (3d6kl2).
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowLawLevel.hint: checked=Show the 'Law Level' field, unchecked=Hide it
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowLawLevel.name: Show the 'Law Level' field on weapon sheets
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowRecoil.name: Show the 'Recoil' field on weapon sheets
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowRateOfFire.name: Show the 'Rate of Fire' field on weapon sheets
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowRateOfFire.hint: checked=Show the 'Rate of Fire' field, unchecked=Hide it
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowDamageType.hint: checked=Show the 'Damage Type' field, unchecked=Hide it
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowDamageType.name: Show the 'Damage Type' field on weapon sheets
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowWeaponType.hint: checked=Show the 'Weapon Type' field, unchecked=Hide it
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowWeaponType.name: Show the 'Weapon Type' field on weapon sheets
TWODSIX.Settings.ShowRangeBandAndHideRan: Show 'Range Band' and *hide* 'Range' on weapon sheets and the character sheet
TWODSIX.Settings.autofireRulesUsed.hint: Select which variant's auto/burst fire rules should be used.
TWODSIX.Settings.autofireRulesUsed.name: Select which variant's auto/burst fire rules should be used.
TWODSIX.Settings.difficultyListUsed.hint: Select which variant's difficulty list should be used.
TWODSIX.Settings.difficultyListUsed.name: Select which variant's difficulty list should be used.
TWODSIX.Settings.difficultiesAsTargetNum: checked=Use target number rather than modifier for difficulties, unchecked=Use modifiers
Use target numbers rather than modifiers for difficulties.
TWODSIX.Settings.ExperimentalFeatures.hi: checked=Boldly use ugly and buggy experimental features that just maybe won't delete your game world, unchecked=Hide them like any sane person would
TWODSIX.Settings.ExperimentalFeatures.na: Show ugly, buggy and unfinished features. I.e., kind of like all the other features that are not hidden by this flag. :)
TWODSIX.Settings.hideUntrainedSkills.hin: checked=Show pseudo-skill 'Untrained' instead of all untrained skills. unchecked=Show all untrained skills
TWODSIX.Settings.hideUntrainedSkills.nam: Hide all untrained skills, instead show a single pseudo-skill named 'Untrained'. This also makes it so new skills are added at 0 instead of the untrained skill value.
TWODSIX.Settings.hideUntrainedSkills.war: After saving the system settings all skills using the pseudo-skill Untrained will be permanently reset to using no skill.This action cannot be undone.
After saving the system settings all actors' weapons that do not have a skill will be updated to use the pseudo-skill Untrained.This action cannot be undone.
TWODSIX.Settings.invertSkillRollShiftCli: Clicking on a skill roll or dragging damage to a character normally shows a dialog, shift-clicking applies default values (Average skill roll or automatic damage distribution). Checking this box swaps this behavior.
Invert behavior for shift-clicking for skill rolls and shift-dragging for taking damage
TWODSIX.Name: Name
TWODSIX.Errors.NoSkillForSkillRoll: You tried to perform a skill roll without specifying a skill
TWODSIX.Errors.NoCharacteristicForRoll: You tried to perform a characteristics roll without specifying a characteristic
TWODSIX.Errors.NoROFForAttack: Rate of fire must be specified for this attack
TWODSIX.Errors.NoDamageForWeapon: This weapon has not specified the damage it does
TWODSIX.Errors.NoAmmo: You are out of ammunition. You need to reload before shooting!
TWODSIX.Errors.OnlyOwnedItems: Can only drop to items that are owned by an actor
TWODSIX.Errors.DraggingSomething: Dragging something that can't be dragged
TWODSIX.Errors.OnlyDropConsumables: Only consumables can be dropped on an item.
TWODSIX.Errors.CouldNotFindItem: Could not find an item with id: _ITEM_ID_
TWODSIX.Errors.DraggedCompendiumIsNotIte: The dragged compendium object is not an item.
TWODSIX.Warnings.AutoDamageForMultipleTa: Automatically damaging multiple targets (using Auto X) is currently not supported
TWODSIX.Warnings.MaxStatVal: The value exceededs the maximum stat value
TWODSIX.Warnings.StatValBelowZero: The value cannot be below zero
TWODSIX.Warnings.DecreaseEnduranceFirst: Endurance should be decreased before other stats
